question_text: Why do organizations often deploy multiple authentication servers?
answer_options: To split log data from different departments
To enable file synchronization across platforms
To ensure users can still log in if one server fails
To assign IP addresses to different VLANs
correct_answer: To ensure users can still log in if one server fails
explanation: Authentication servers are often duplicated for redundancy, ensuring continued access in case of hardware failure or outages.
